010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.BilateralF.Parameters;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
017import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel2D;
018import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
019import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * Vector (non-separable) version of the Bilateral filter as proposed in [1], 
024 * for RGB images ({@link ColorProcessor}) only.
025 * The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all 
026 * image types. See Sec. 17.2 of [2] for additional details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images",
030 * Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision,
031 * Bombay, India.
032 * <br>
033 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
034 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
035 * </p>
036 * 
037 * @author WB
038 * @version 2021/01/01
039 */
040public class BilateralFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector {
041        
042        private final float[][] Hd;     // the domain kernel
043        private final int K;            // the domain kernel size [-K,...,K]
044        private final double sigmaR2;
045        private final VectorNorm colorNorm;
046        private final double colorScale2;
047        
048        public BilateralFilterVector() {
049                this(new Parameters());
050        }
051        
052        public BilateralFilterVector(Parameters params) {
053                GaussianKernel2D kernel = new GaussianKernel2D(params.sigmaD);
054                this.Hd = kernel.getH();
055                this.K = kernel.getXc();
056                this.sigmaR2 = sqr(params.sigmaR);
057                this.colorNorm = params.colorNormType.getInstance();
058                this.colorScale2 = sqr(colorNorm.getScale(3));
059        }
060        
061        @Override
062        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
063                float[] S = new float[3];       // sum of weighted RGB values
064                float W = 0;                            // sum of weights
065                float[] a = pack.getPix(u, v);                  // value of the current center pixel
066                
067                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
068                        for (int n = -K; n <= K; n++) {
069                                float[] b = pack.getPix(u + m, v + n);
070                                float wd = Hd[m + K][n + K];                            // domain weight
071                                float wr = similarityGauss(a, b);                       // range weight
072                                float w = wd * wr;
073                                S[0] = S[0] + w * b[0];
074                                S[1] = S[1] + w * b[1];
075                                S[2] = S[2] + w * b[2];
076                                W = W + w;
077                        }
078                }
079                S[0] = S[0] / W;
080                S[1] = S[1] / W;
081                S[2] = S[2] / W;
082                return S;
083        }
084        
085        // ------------------------------------------------------
086        
087        // This returns the weights for a Gaussian range kernel (color vector version):
088        private float similarityGauss(float[] A, float[] B) {
089                double d2 = colorScale2 * colorNorm.distance2(A, B);
090                return (float) Math.exp(-d2 / (2 * sigmaR2));
091        }
092}
